column4: Hey guys, I had to use a live CD to get my Ubuntu working again. How do I copy the video settings to my old partition so I don't have to just reinstall everything?
You most likely want /etc/X11/xorg.conf but be sure to back up your existing config.
I copied the ENTIRE X11 folder from etc unto the partition, and it still stalled on booting the X server.
What does /var/log/Xorg.0.log have to say about it?
I don't understand. That is a huge file.
Well typically you would want to cat /var/log/Xorg.0.log|grep ^EE
That would give you all the errors.
cat it on the partitio that fails to boot? Or the live CD I am currently on?
The partition that is not booting.
Then what do I do?
Did you recieve any lines of output from that command?
There are tons of errors.
Is there a timestamp with the error messages?
no
I recently switched monitors as well. How do I make Ubuntu reconfigure for my new monitor from the command line?
I believe the command is: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xorg
But would you please paste the last flew error lines to paste.ubuntu.com?
Here it is: http://paste.ubuntu.com/424327/
Is that after  you ran the reconfigure?
no. Running the reconfigure did nothing for me before.
that is the output from the partition that won't load X.
You may want to rename the existing xorg.conf and create an empty one in its place and see if the defaults lets you start X.
